description.narrative: Fjärrvärmeinvestering i Ivano Frankivsk Ukriana. Sverige ha bidragit med ett investeringsbidrag.
Investment support to Ivano-Frankivsk District Heating Project in Ukraine. Sweden has contributed with an investment grant.

The Ivano-Frankivsk District Heating Project addresses the urgent investments targeted at improving the energy efficiency as well as the quality of district heating service provision and reduced losses incurred in the distribution networks. The introduction of individual heating substations represents the first step investments at the customer demand side that will transfer control of heating from the supplier to the end-users. And biomass fueled boiler generates heat using carbon neutral energy source contributing to emission reductions. The Sida investment grant of MSEK 41.5 is used to (i) co-finance purchasing of a 4MW biofuel boiler along with the auxiliary equipment at the Troleybusna boiler house, and (ii) finance up to 144 individual heat substations (“IHSs”) in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in Ukraine.

description.narrative: Th priority investment programme of the Ivano-Frankivsk TeploKomunenergo (the DH Company), the main supplier of the heat energy in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in Ukraine and the operator of the city's district heating (DH) network was not fully implemented as planned. During the Activity Period, which has been extended four times after the loan restructuring for the total period of thirty-eight months, the DH Company: 1. Reconstructed three boiler houses stipulated by the project located at Medychna, Dovha and Vyskovykh Veteraniv Streets (reduction of natural gas consumption by 1,356,600 m3 per year; reduction of electricity consumption by 288.6 MWh per year; reduction of CO2 emissions by 667.6 tons per year; latest cost savings: UAH 9.7 million per year). 2. Installed the largest biomass-fired boiler in Ivano-Frankivsk at the Troleybusna boiler house (the element was co-financed from the Sida investment grant - reduction of natural gas consumption by up to 2,660,000 m3 per year; reduction of electricity consumption by 196 MWh per year; reduction of CO2 emissions by 5,054 tons per year; latest cost savings: UAH 4.1 million per year). 3. Replaced a smaller part of the DH networks on Stusa and Khotkevicha St (reduction of natural gas consumption by 33,400 m3 per year; reduction of electricity consumption by 11.3 MWh per year; reduction of CO2 emissions by 64.7 tons per year; latest cost savings: UAH 0.24 million per year, connection of several residential buildings serviced by the Industrialna boiler house). The DH Company has not implemented the following components: - replacement of the major part of the DH networks;- installation of the individual heat substations - IHS - (to be financed from the Sida investment grant), and- reconstruction of Doroshenka boiler house. The unutilized amount of the investment grant (circa EUR 2.8 million) has been returned to Sida in accordance with the agreement. The DH Company has received (i) five loan disbursements for the total amount of EUR 2,413,589.32 used for the aforementioned components and (ii) one grant disbursement for the total amount of EUR 799,200.00, which was used for co-financing of the installation of the aforementioned biomass boiler at Troleybusna boiler house.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
